item.title: Advanced Stochastic Modelling and Monte Carlo methods
item.description: In Semester 1 this year, I will again be teaching an honours course which I have roughly titled: Advanced Stochastic Modelling and Monte Carlo methods. For those of you considering it, this post gives an outline of the topics I intend to cover this year. Due to the restrictions on in-person teaching and workload constraints, all honours courses will be run as reading courses. This means there will be no lectures and instead a single weekly workshop.

item.title: Doherty coronavirus modelling work
item.description: Two pieces of work I have contributed to on the Australian response to COVID-19 have been published on the Doherty Institute website. Update: The first piece of work on the scenario modelling has now been published in Emerging Infectious Diseases. The risk analysis work is still undergoing a rather lengthy review, but a preprint can be found on medRXiv.

item.title: The Conversation: How to flatten the curve of coronavirus, a mathematician explains
item.description: An article in the Conversation by myself, Dennis Liu and Lewis Mitchell. How to flatten the curve of coronavirus, a mathematician explains.

item.title: New paper published: Ecological scaffolding and the evolution of individuality
item.description: Our paper on Ecological scaffolding and the evolution of individuality has been published online in Nature Ecology and Evolution. There is an accompanying news and views article as well as an interactive visualisation of the first model using Observable.js.
